    public static class InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.CallbackConfiguration
extends Object
    The configuration for analyzing callbacks in Android apps

    Steven Arzt

        Copies the settings of the given configuration into this configuration object

      • setEnableCallbacks

        public void setEnableCallbacks(boolean enableCallbacks)
        Sets whether the taint analysis shall consider callbacks
        Parameters:
        enableCallbacks - True if taints shall be tracked through callbacks, otherwise false

      • getEnableCallbacks

        public boolean getEnableCallbacks()
        Gets whether the taint analysis shall consider callbacks
        Returns:
        True if taints shall be tracked through callbacks, otherwise false

      • setCallbackAnalyzer

        public void setCallbackAnalyzer(InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.CallbackAnalyzer callbackAnalyzer)
        Sets the callback analyzer to be used in preparation for the taint analysis
        Parameters:
        callbackAnalyzer - The callback analyzer to be used

      • getCallbackAnalyzer

        public InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.CallbackAnalyzer getCallbackAnalyzer()
        Gets the callback analyzer that is being used in preparation for the taint analysis
        Returns:
        The callback analyzer being used

      • setFilterThreadCallbacks

        public void setFilterThreadCallbacks(boolean filterThreadCallbacks)
        Sets whether the callback analysis algorithm should follow paths that contain threads. If this option is disabled, callbacks only registered in threads will be missed. If it is enabled, context-insensitive callgraph algorithms can lead to a high number of false positives for the callback analyzer.
        Parameters:
        filterThreadCallbacks - True to discover callbacks registered in threads, otherwise false

      • getFilterThreadCallbacks

        public boolean getFilterThreadCallbacks()
        Gets whether the callback analysis algorithm should follow paths that contain threads. If this option is disabled, callbacks only registered in threads will be missed. If it is enabled, context-insensitive callgraph algorithms can lead to a high number of false positives for the callback analyzer.
        Returns:
        True to discover callbacks registered in threads, otherwise false

      • getMaxCallbacksPerComponent

        public int getMaxCallbacksPerComponent()
        Gets the maximum number of callbacks per component. If the callback collector finds more callbacks than this number for one given component, the analysis will assume that precision has degraded too much and will analyze this component without callbacks.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of callbacks per component

      • setMaxCallbacksPerComponent

        public void setMaxCallbacksPerComponent(int maxCallbacksPerComponent)
        Sets the maximum number of callbacks per component. If the callback collector finds more callbacks than this number for one given component, the analysis will assume that precision has degraded too much and will analyze this component without callbacks.
        Parameters:
        maxCallbacksPerComponent - The maximum number of callbacks per component

      • getCallbackAnalysisTimeout

        public int getCallbackAnalysisTimeout()
        Gets the timeout in seconds after which the callback analysis shall be stopped. After the timeout, the data flow analysis will continue with those callbacks that have been found so far.
        Returns:
        The callback analysis timeout in seconds

      • setCallbackAnalysisTimeout

        public void setCallbackAnalysisTimeout(int callbackAnalysisTimeout)
        Sets the timeout in seconds after which the callback analysis shall be stopped. After the timeout, the data flow analysis will continue with those callbacks that have been found so far.
        Parameters:
        callbackAnalysisTimeout - The callback analysis timeout in seconds

      • getMaxAnalysisCallbackDepth

        public int getMaxAnalysisCallbackDepth()
        Gets the maximum depth up to which the callback analyzer shall look into chains of callbacks registering other callbacks. A value equal to or smaller than zero indicates an infinite maximum depth.
        Returns:
        The maximum depth up to which to look into callback registration chains.

      • setMaxAnalysisCallbackDepth

        public void setMaxAnalysisCallbackDepth(int maxCallbackAnalysisDepth)
        Sets the maximum depth up to which the callback analyzer shall look into chains of callbacks registering other callbacks. A value equal to or smaller than zero indicates an infinite maximum depth.
        Parameters:
        maxCallbackAnalysisDepth - The maximum depth up to which to look into callback registration chains.
